intro: Dalechampia amambayensis, commonly known as the Amambay dalechampia, is a flowering plant native to the tropical regions of South America. It belongs to the family Euphorbiaceae, which includes a wide variety of plants with diverse morphological characteristics. The plant is characterized by its palmate leaves and produces small, inconspicuous flowers clustered in cyathia, typical of the Euphorbiaceae family. It thrives in humid, tropical climates and is often found in lowland forests. Due to its limited distribution, it is considered a rare species with potential ecological and botanical significance.
